summary: This bill reauthorizes the PROTECT Our Children Act of 2008, focusing on combating child exploitation. It mandates a national strategy update every four years, with analysis of trends, solutions, and resource needs. It amends sections related to the National ICAC Task Force Program, including expanding participant agencies, evaluating task force effectiveness, and establishing limited liability protections. The bill also modifies reporting requirements, authorizes appropriations for the ICAC grant program, and increases funding over the next three fiscal years. Finally, it makes some minor changes to current laws regarding reporting requirements.
